dialogue.text: Focus on your breath. Let thoughts pass like clouds. Find your center.
I was following something. Just not the script.
I see it sometimes. People who've touched the real thing. The ones who can't pretend anymore that enlightenment is a stress-reduction technique.
Oh, you're one of those. The ones the question has claimed. How long?
There's a group. People who've been infected by the real questions. We meet Thursdays. Not to answer—answering is the disease. But to question together.

visual_elements.instructor_transformation: Professional mask dropping to reveal fellow seeker

psychological_notes: In the most unlikely setting—corporate mindfulness training—Evan discovers another person claimed by the real questions. The instructor recognizes him as someone who can't pretend anymore, leading to an invitation to join others who question together. This shifts the journey from solitary to communal.
philosophical_underpinning: The question as contagion that connects seekers
therapeutic_direction: From isolated questioning to shared wonder
